TopicTitle: Submarines. How do I make one?

Articles.Content:
The title pretty much sums up my question.

I know it's possible, I saw some on Youtube. Still I have no idea how to do that. Is it possible without mods?

Yes, it is. You will either need very heavy parts, or active propulsion to push you downwards. Not much more to it than that.

You could get some inspiration from [this challenge](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113743-Deep-Diver-Challenge!).

Hydrophobic parts and tremendous speed??

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xsM5CitUJ_k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

OP jmile69

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-09T15:49:40Z" title="04/09/2015 03:49  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 9, 2015</time> by Aethon**
You could use the Hooligan Subs mod, works with 0.90 as far as I have tested.

The X200-16 is about the smallest tank that will sink. If you add any air intakes, expect to get a lot of bouyancy. However, you can use engines (including jet engines) underwater to give yourself some extra downward push.

Cheers,

-Claw

BoatParts

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24845-Boat-Parts-0-90-R4-65](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24845-Boat-Parts-0-90-R4-65)

has a submarine or two.
